header.title: The Scroll of Set - December 1989
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Left Hand Path, Setianism, Magic

central_thesis: The Scroll of Set, December 1989, articulates a comprehensive Left Hand Path philosophy centered on individual self-overcoming (Xeper) and the practical application of Black Magic to master subjective reality and incrementally influence objective reality. It emphasizes the subjective nature of astral projection, systematic magical warm-ups for personal discipline, and a profound reinterpretation of immortality as an innate aspect of consciousness, cultivated through deliberate self-transformation rather than external conferment. The publication underscores the active pursuit of individual will and mastery in all aspects of existence.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] Black Magic and Astral Projection - by Adam Campbell I°
structure_content.summary: This article critiques 'white magic' views of the Astral Plane as objective, asserting it as a purely subjective creation of the individual. For the Black Magician, the astral state is the ideal consciousness for magical workings, offering total control over one's subjective universe. This enables manipulations not possible in normal consciousness. The process involves separating the mind from the physical body and forming the desired astral world through concentrated will, distinct from mere imagination. The goal is to 'nudge' objective events and create pathways, necessitating careful thought before entering the astral state. This subjective creation underpins Greater Black Magic and Xeper.

structure_content.chapter_title: [4] Magical Warm-Ups - by Brian Zimmer II°
structure_content.summary: This section provides practical exercises for Black Magicians to gain initial mastery over self and environment, emphasizing individual experimentation over rigid rules. Practices include: 1. Deep, conscious breathing for body control and altered states; 2. Observing and selecting diet based on personal effects, cultivating self-awareness; 3. Entering the Subjective State (self-hypnosis/trance) to assert sovereign will; 4. Practicing Rational Thinking to precisely understand objective reality and discern cause-effect, preventing subjective distortions; 5. Indulgence/Deprivation, a technique for discovering true will and checking compulsive behavior by controlled frustration followed by guilt-free indulgence, rather than asceticism.

structure_content.chapter_title: [6] Blindness by Faith - by Darrell Gilliam I°
structure_content.summary: This personal narrative describes an intense, trance-like experience initially attributed to possession by a 'God' (Holy Ghost) within a traditional religious framework. The author subsequently reinterprets this experience through the 'Gift of Set' as an internal, 'over exaggerated, sensational emotion' originating from his own mind. This realization shifts the understanding from external deity to internal discovery and self-control, emphasizing the individual's path to self-understanding and mastery ('to be me, in my truest form') in contrast to blind faith.

structure_content.chapter_title: [7] Observations of a Stage Hypnotist - by Kevin Grise Iº
structure_content.summary: This article explores stage hypnosis, highlighting its mechanisms and their application beyond the stage. It identifies four key methods for inducing trance and cooperation: fear (e.g., public speaking), intimidation (daring subjects), authority (projecting confidence), and peer pressure (audience expectation). The author notes that a significant percentage of people are 'somnambulistic personality types' easily entranced. Practical advice includes pre-testing subjects, seating arrangements to break friend groups, memorizing routines, swiftly addressing hecklers, and using sensory effects. The underlying principle is that these psychological tools, used in advertising and politics, are effective for influencing others and gaining cooperation.

structure_content.chapter_title: [14] The Transformation of Mitchell Wade - by Michael A. Aquino VI°
structure_content.summary: This philosophical reflection on the passing of Setian Mitchell Wade reinterprets his physical death not as an end but a 'transformation' and a 'Greatest War' revealing his character. Aquino posits that Wade's 'ba' (the true, essential, immortal self) persists, encouraging Setians to interact with him magically, akin to recognizing the immortality of other Setians. This concept of 'Remanifestation' in 'Walhalla' reinforces the Setian philosophy of innate immortality and Xeper, or self-deification, extending beyond physical existence.

structure_content.chapter_title: [15] The Secrets of Life and Death IV - by Michael A. Aquino VI°
structure_content.summary: This article delves into Setian philosophy on life, death, and immortality, contrasting it with conventional views. Drawing on Taoist philosophy ('The Secret of the Golden Flower') and ancient Egyptian wisdom, it asserts that 'life' is a divine transforming power and that the 'Ka' or 'entelechy' (immortal soul) is an inherent, trans-biological aspect of man. Pagan theology's three levels of post-mortem consciousness (Hades/Hel, Elysian Fields/Walhalla, divine status) are discussed as states achieved through self-cultivation. Crucially, it declares that 'immortality is innate in all conscious beings,' not conferred, but realized through Xeper, emphasizing a shift in 'perspective and proportion' during initiation. It critiques Christianity's use of death fear and materialistic science's denial of intangible values.

key_concepts.definition: For Black Magicians, the astral state is not an objective 'higher plane' but a purely subjective construct of the individual's mind, allowing total control and enabling magical workings by manipulating one's own created reality.

The core Setian philosophy of 'self-overcoming' and 'self-deification,' signifying a continuous process of individual transformation, becoming more than one was, and realizing one's innate divinity and immortality.

A practice focused on the manipulation of one's subjective universe to incrementally 'nudge' or create pathways for desired changes in the objective universe, always from a Left Hand Path perspective emphasizing individual will and mastery.

A private mental realm where the individual's will is sovereign and absolute, accessible through techniques like self-hypnosis or astral projection, distinct from the shared, objective physical world.

The Setian belief that the immortality of the 'ba' (true, essential self) or 'psyche' is an inherent quality of all conscious beings, not something earned or granted, but realized and appreciated through self-awareness and Xeper, rather than conferred by external entities.

A practical exercise for self-mastery and discovering true will, involving the controlled, temporary frustration of a desire, followed by deliberate, guilt-free indulgence, aimed at understanding and checking compulsive behaviors.

A practice of systematic, precise thought and direct experience of both subjective and objective universes, crucial for the Black Magician to discern effects from causes and prevent subjective influences from distorting objective reality.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is a rigorous regimen for individual self-mastery and manipulation of the subjective universe, ultimately aimed at achieving Xeper. It emphasizes cultivating a powerful, disciplined will and a precise understanding of both subjective and objective realities. The core methodology involves using the 'subjective universe' as a controlled environment for magical workings, with the intent of incrementally shaping external circumstances through internal transformation, rather than attempting overt, forceful changes on objective reality. This is a highly individualistic and experimental path, encouraging practitioners to discover techniques best suited to their unique nature.
tools: Will/Force of Will: The central operative faculty for directing subjective creation and influencing reality.
Conscious Awareness/Observation: Essential for understanding internal and external phenomena, particularly regarding diet, breathing, and psychological states.
Discipline: The consistent application of practices to achieve self-mastery and maintain focus.
Rational Thought: A systematic approach to understanding the objective universe and discerning cause-effect relationships.
Knowledge of Subjective and Objective Universes: A clear understanding of the boundaries and interactions between one's internal reality and the external world.
Self-Hypnosis/Trance Techniques: Methods for intentionally altering states of consciousness to access the subjective universe.
rituals: Astral Projection: Entering a subjective state by deliberate separation of the mind from the physical body, followed by the summoning or forming of desired astral worlds through focused will. This is distinct from passive imagination.
Deep Breathing: Conscious, deep breathing exercises to gain physical control and influence mental, emotional, and physical states for magical preparation.
Entering the Subjective State (Self-Hypnosis/Trance): Various techniques for accessing a private mental realm where individual will is sovereign, to be proficiently mastered by the practitioner.

Indulgence/Deprivation Exercise: A structured practice involving the deliberate frustration of a desire for a set period, followed by its full, guilt-free indulgence, to test and understand one's true will and control compulsive behaviors.

relevant_quotes.text: The key advantage with astral states is that they allow the manipulation of the magician's subjective universe in ways not normally attainable with normal consciousness.
In essence astral projection underpins the entire methodology of Greater Black Magic.
By using the tools of indulgence and deprivation, Black Magicians attempt to discover and attune to what they really want and desire; in a word, to their true will.
The language a person uses is a map to the inner reality of that person.
For Hell doth bequeath to man his perfect freedom, and such a gift can never be recalled.

As the sage in Her-Bak emphasized, this immortality is innate in all conscious beings. You have it already, by evidence of that same consciousness which enables you to read and understand these words. It is nothing which the Temple of Set 'confers' on you; rather it is something which conventional churches have tried to trick you out of, and which materialistic science has denied simply because it is an aspect of existence which transcends science [hence is not subject to "scientific proof"].

What is life? It is a form of the divine presence. It is the power, immanent in created things, to change themselves by successive destructions of form until the spirit or activating force of the original life-stream is freed.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Scroll of Set - December 1989 is a critical historical document for understanding the evolving philosophy and practical applications within the Temple of Set during a pivotal period. It reinforces foundational Setian tenets like Xeper and the subjective nature of reality, clearly positioning Black Magic as a tool for radical self-transformation and the realization of innate divinity. The articles by Aquino, Campbell, and Zimmer articulate a distinct Left Hand Path perspective, sharply contrasting with Abrahamic and New Age spiritualities. The inclusion of legal updates demonstrates the contemporary challenges faced by occult organizations and the resilience required to maintain operational integrity amidst public misunderstanding and prejudice, showing how the philosophy is applied to external, real-world pressures.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is Initiates and practitioners within the Temple of Set and other Left Hand Path traditions, as the language assumes familiarity with occult concepts and Setian terminology. It also holds significant relevance for scholars of modern esotericism and new religious movements interested in the practical and philosophical underpinnings of the Temple of Set, offering direct insight into its internal discourse and operative principles.
